FuncDef:
The ip-pool-group command binds an address pool group to a domain.
The undo ip-pool-group command unbinds an address pool group from a domain.
By default, no address pool group is bound to a domain.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an address pool group.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 case-insensitive characters.

Specifies the information on the address pool groups. The value depends on the number of address pool group configured in the domain. The maximum value is 1024.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 1024.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If different domains share some address pools, these address pools can be configured to form an address pool group. The address pool group simplifies configuration.
Prerequisites
An address pool has been created.
Configuration Impact
After an address pool group is bound to a domain, all address pools in that group are bound to the domain.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
Note the following issues after using the ip-pool-group command:
After an address pool group is bound to a domain, the VPN instance to which the address pool group is bound cannot be modified, and no more address pools can be added to or deleted from this address pool group.A maximum of eight address pool groups can be bound to a domain.A maximum of 1024 IPv4 address pools can be bound to a domain.
